reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award APHIS facilitated a 5-day training workshop in Malaysia on pest risk analysis methods associated with international trade in plant products. In safeguarding domestic plant health from pests and diseases, importing countries use pest risk analysis to evaluate foreign market access requests. 30 Biosecurity officers from 3 countries (Malaysia, Philippines and Vietnam) participated in the activity, incorporating three key training activities (To identify pests and/or pathways of quarantine concern and evaluate their risk, to identify endangered areas, and, if appropriate, to identify risk management options). Project Objective: The program focused on: 1. Strengthening the national laws and countries' technical capacity on regulating the import of live plants from other country; 2. Meeting PRA requirements of importing countries and their markets; and 3.Strengthening safeguarding systems that protect domestic plant resources from non-native plants and invasive species..

participating-org.narrative: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (APHIS)
The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: U.S. foreign assistance in Malaysia promotes peace and security by strengthening cooperation on law enforcement, nonproliferation, counterterrorism, rule of law, and expanding military ties. Assistance will further Malaysia's role as a reliable partner in maintaining regional stability, fighting terrorism and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction (WMD), and strengthening key regional and global institutions that will contribute to the America's security. Counterterrorism (CT) assistance builds capacity within Malaysian law enforcement and judicial organizations; supports activities to improve Malaysia's border security; and strengthens networks between civil society, the government, and the private sector to counter violent extremism (CVE). Counter-proliferation assistance strengthens Malaysia's ability to prevent transshipments of controlled munitions and dual-use commodities. Military assistance and training builds critical capabilities among Malaysia's armed forces, allowing it to take on an expanded international role, including peacekeeping and stabilization operations and promotes a positive and lasting transformation of the U.S.-Malaysian relationship to further shared goals.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Agricultural Quarantine Inspection User Fee Account, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service
